Civic Board of Directors
InstanceEndEditable
InstanceBeginEditable name="content"
The Civic Association of Imperial Harbor, Inc.
P.O. Box 366064
Bonita Springs, Fl   34136
E-Mail:
ihcivicassoc@gmail.com
The Civic Association Officers and Directors
Our goals are lofty, just as we suspect yours are too.  Our first and foremost priority is to keep Imperial Harbor a 55+ community.  We intend to visit, contact, email, text, or call all 654 homes in the park to ensure the residents fit our Deed of Restrictions, as best we can.
President
Doug Gilliam
douggilliam14@gmail.com

Annual Membership Meeting
Second Thursday of January
7:00 PM at The Harbor Club

General Membership Meetings
First Thursday of each month - November thru April
except January when an Annual Meeting is held
7:00 PM at The Harbor Club
Notice posted on the Association bulletin board 48 hours prior to meeting.
Exceptions to meeting dates will be posted on the Association bulletin board 48 hours prior to the new meeting date.
Board of Director Meetings
As noted by BOD - October thru April
Summer meetings as needed.
Notice posted on the Association bulletin board 48 hours prior to meeting including meeting location.

InstanceBeginEditable name="title_inner"
Civic Association Membership Form
InstanceEndEditable
InstanceBeginEditable name="content"
THE CIVIC ASSOCIATION OF IMPERIAL HARBOR, INC.
A 55+ DEED RESTRICTED COMMUNITY
P.O. BOX 366064
BONITA SPRINGS, FL 34136
Email: ihcivicassoc@gmail.com     Website: www.imperialharbor.org
The mission of the Association is to maintain the community of Imperial Harbor as an “over 55-year-old community” in perpetuity.  The Association shall be responsible for determining the interpretation and appropriate action to enforce the deed of restrictions.  The Association shall maintain a liaison to established governmental and civic organizations whose activities have a direct bearing on the community residents.  It shall strive to communicate information to all.
Civic Association Membership Form 2025
Last Name ________________________  First  ____________________________
Local Street and House Number ______________________
ANNUAL DUES $50.00 - entitles one vote per property, in any Election or General Membership meeting.

Signature _________________________ Date ___________________________
DO YOU HAVE AN INTEREST TO VOLUNTEER IN THE FOLLOWING ASSOCIATION COMMITTEES?
Welcome Packages______ Census _______      Delivering Directories _____      Sign-in table_______
Tag Sale ___________      Board of Directors ______     Committees ______      Block Captain ____
Fundraisers _________     Membership Drive _______    Citing Prayer at Meetings ______________
Leading the Pledge of Allegiance _______                     “Keeping Imperial Harbor Beautiful”                 revised 2/7/25

InstanceBeginEditable name="title_inner"
New Club Members Information
InstanceEndEditable
InstanceBeginEditable name="content"
Welcome to Imperial Harbor and Harbor Club
Now that you are settled in, you might want to find out how to become a club member.  We are a completely volunteer based club.  Our officers and staff are all volunteers that live in the community. Because of that, we have very limited hours.  Office hours and days are posted at the bottom of every page on this site.  They hours change based on season, but it's always open on Wed of each week.
First, we have limited availability for new membership.  It doesn't mean we don't have it, but you will need to check with the office and see what is available.
Download your application form for quick and easy process.
If your home came with a club membership upon purchasing, congratulations, you can transfer the certificate into your name.  You will need to bring that into the office, along with a copy of your deed and IDs such as a Drivers License of Passport.  Access to Club facilities will not be available until after your certificate has been transferred over.
If you are applying for a brand new membership, meaning your house didn't come with it at the time of sale, then there will be a $1,500 one time fee to join.  This fee is refundable if you ever choose to sell your membership back to the club.  Annual fees are $350 per year. This fee grants access to our swimming pool, gym, billiard room, shuffle board courts and Bocce ball.  It also allows you to attend the many events in the clubhouse as well as games and more.
Membership renewal is sent out by email every year around Nov 15 and can be paid online (preffered method), mail with check, or in the office.
We do not accept cash for membership renewals.
New electronic membership access cards will be available for office pick up when announded available.  It will be a different color from previous years. New cards take effect as of Jan 1 that year.
As a club member, we recommend you join our
Harbor Club Facebook
group.  We will post club news, upcoming events, trips, games and special dinners/dance.  Club members will not be able to post directly to the group.  We are trying to keep it simple and information only. You can post a question but it will require approval to go live.  If its a simple question, then we will answer it directly to you.
For social, selling stuff,
questions that are non-club related
, making friends, we suggest you join the
Imperial Harbor Facebook
group.  This is for ALL residents and not just club members.  Because of that, no club information/questions will be posted or communicated on that group.
Once a month during season, we have a general assembly.  During this meeting, you will have the opportunity to vote on proposed projects, find out about enhancements and the financial state of our clubhouse.  We need you to make every effort to attend when you are in town. These meetings are usually 1-hour or less.
In addition to above, here are some additional basic information.
POOL:
Hours are from dawn to dusk, but understand, we do not have paid staff.  EVERYTHING is based on you volunteering.  We encourage new people to volunteer when asked as a way to make friends.  Sign-up sheets can be found near the entrance to the bathrooms by the pool or inside bulletin board.  We ask for volunteers to open and close the pool.  Because of that, the time is flexible.  The pool will remain closed during weather issues.  For instance, during a tropical storm or hurricane, we will need volunteers to help secure outdoor furnitures.  When the pool has been inspect for damage or debris, the pool can open and we will need volunteers again to put outdoor furniture out.  During a cold spell, the pool will remain closed until the temperatures warm up.  Usually you can expect anything below 67 F to cause the pool to remain closed.
VOLUNTEER!
This club has managed to keep it's dues low due to your neighbors willing to volunteer.  If we didn't have volunteers, thus hiring staff, your dues would go up.  Our busiest time is during season, which falls between Nov - Mar of every year.  We encourage seasonal people to volunteer during those months.  We have permanent residents as well and they usually volunteer off season.
EVENTS:
Special activities or events usually require you to sign up.  This will be in the form of a sign-up sheet located inside the club house.  Posts on Facebook Events are curtesy notifications only and do not count as signing up for the event. This will help our volunteers know how much food, space will be required.  We have limited seating at some events and it will be on a first come, first serve basis.  Some events will have the ability to pay online via this website.  If that is the case, your payment is your sign up.
SPECIAL EVENTS TICKET SALES:
From time to time, we host special events, such as a dance party or entertainment.  This events require advance purchase of tickets.  Most of the times the tickets will be sold out and can't be purchased at the door.  The club Facebook and newsletter will be the best way to get information about these events. You can buy tickets via our website, but you must register first.  Also volunteers will sell them during cafe or lunch events (check club calendar) and during office hours.  In person we accept cash or checks, online you can use bank transfer or credit/debit card.
HARBORITE NEWSLETTER:
We also publish a monthly newsletter that is available on our website, club Facebook and limited printed copies in the library next to the office.  This is a great source of information on happenings and events.

InstanceBeginEditable name="content"
Imperial Harbor is a 55+ , deed restricted community, where each home is independently owned and not leased.  The only fees is if you decide to join our club, rent space in our compound or join our civic association.  All are
not
mandatory. Our club house does not have information on homes for sale, rentals or leasing.  We are a social club that might be able to answer club related questions.  Please review our website for full information or check with a realtor.
